title: improve chat response accessible view
body:
fix #284313

In the chat response accessible view, tool calls were showing incomplete information:
- "Created" with no filename
- "Made changes" without context
- "Apply patch" with empty backticks

This happened because the accessible view code only included tool invocations when `resultDetails` had an `input` property. Tools using URI arrays or no input details were skipped entirely.

Before: Tool invocations were only shown if `resultDetails && 'input' in resultDetails`

After:

- Tool invocations now always show their `invocationMessage` when completed or executing
- For tools with `IToolResultInputOutputDetails` the input is included using localized strings
- Serialized tool invocations now prefer `pastTenseMessage` falling back to `invocationMessage`
- Serialized invocations appear even without input details
- Added explicit state handling for `Completed` states
- Used `isToolResultInputOutputDetails()` type guard instead of checking `'input' in resultDetails`
- Added localized strings for better accessibility
- Ensured all completed/executing tools are announced, not just those with input details
- Created a new test suite with 9 tests covering

title: Fix backticks not rendered as markdown in task progress messages
body:
Task progress messages in chat were displaying backticks literally instead of rendering them as inline code (e.g., "Checked output for task `Core - Build`" showed raw backticks). The `MarkdownString` constructor requires `{ supportThemeIcons: true }` to enable markdown rendering. Without it, syntax like backticks is treated as plain text. **Changes:** - Added `{ supportThemeIcons: true }` option to all `MarkdownString` constructors containing backtick-formatted text in: - `getTaskOutputTool.ts` (5 instances) - `createAndRunTaskTool.ts` (6 instances) - `runTaskTool.ts` (7 instances) **Example:** ```typescript // Before new MarkdownString(localize('copilotChat.checkedTerminalOutput', 'Checked output for task \`{0}\`', taskLabel)) // After new MarkdownString(localize('copilotChat.checkedTerminalOutput', 'Checked output for task \`{0}\`', taskLabel), { supportThemeIcons: true }) ```
Original prompt > > ---- > > *This section details on the original issue you should resolve* > > backticks not converted to markdown for task progress message > > > ## Comments on the Issue (you are @copilot in this section) > > > @meganrogge > It shows `checked output for task `Core Build`` where the ` is not rendered as markdown, but should be. > >
- Fixes microsoft/vscode#287593 --- ðŸ’¬ We'd love your input! Share your thoughts on Copilot coding agent in our [2 minute survey](https://gh.io/copilot-coding-agent-survey).

title: Fix locked optionGroup display in chat input - show grayed out, non-clickable
body:
## Description

Locked optionGroup items in chat input were rendering as clickable dropdowns with a single disabled option. They now display as grayed-out, non-interactive elements.

### Changes

**Visual Rendering (`ChatSessionPickerActionItem.ts`, `SearchableOptionPickerActionItem.ts`)**
- Chevron-down icon always displayed (grayed out via CSS when locked)
- `updateEnabled()` override temporarily modifies `action.enabled` before calling parent's implementation
- Applies `locked` CSS class to container on render and state changes
- Stores container reference in protected property for state management

**Styling (`chatSessionPickerActionItem.css`)**
- Locked items: `opacity: 0.6`, `pointer-events: none`, `cursor: default`

### Implementation Notes

Disables dropdown by temporarily setting `action.enabled = false` when locked, then calling `super.updateEnabled()` which properly updates the dropdown and DOM state. Original `action.enabled` value is restored immediately after. This approach avoids type casting and maintains type safety while properly delegating to the parent class's implementation. Container reference is captured during `render()` to manage locked state styling.

The visual treatment is subtle: locked options show the same chevron-down icon as unlocked options, but the entire element (including the chevron) is grayed out via CSS opacity, providing a consistent and clean indication of the locked state.

<!-- START COPILOT ORIGINAL PROMPT -->



<details>

<summary>Original prompt</summary>

> when an optionGroup item is 'locked' in the chat input part, it should show is 'grayed out' and not clickable.  Right now it renders as a dropdown menu with a single option
> 
> The user has attached the following file paths as relevant context:
>  - src/vs/workbench/contrib/chat/browser/widget/input/chatInputPart.ts
>  - .github/instructions/chat.instructions.md
>  - .github/instructions/learnings.instructions.md
>  - .github/copilot-instructions.md
>  - AGENTS.md


</details>

title: fix how `_selectVendorDefaultLanguageModel` is set
fix: capture diagnostics and add workaround for graphite recording order failures
body:
Refs https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/284162#issuecomment-3745785115

To aid with debugging the broken rendering issue on macOS with the skia graphite backend. This PR does the following,

1) Runtime update incorporates the following patches
[feat_support_gpu_switch_to_recover_from_recording_order_failure.patch](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/24616081/feat_support_gpu_switch_to_recover_from_recording_order_failure.patch)
[feat_improve_diagnostics_and_support_recover_from_record_insertion.patch](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/24616079/feat_improve_diagnostics_and_support_recover_from_record_insertion.patch)
2) https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/commit/59e3bae058dc3b5627f705e31bc2a7c8fd092170 adds support for exposing gpu log messages from `chrome://gpu-internals` as part of `--status` flag. Reasoning

```
This is useful in scenarios where the application rendering
completely breaks and we want to know the health of gpu process
on demand without having to restart the application.

The log messages are usually available on demand via
Developer: Show GPU Info page but during complete rendering failure
the developer page will also fail to render.
```
3) Add support argv.json entry `enable-graphite-invalid-recording-recovery` that will trigger the workaround path in the runtime to recover from the failures.

auto_merge.commit_title: fix: capture diagnostics and add workaround for graphite recording order failures (#287798)
auto_merge.commit_message:
* feat: expose gpu log messages as part of --status

This is useful in scenarios where the application rendering
completely breaks and we want to know the health of gpu process
on demand without having to restart the application.

The log messages are usually available on demand via
Developer: Show GPU Info page but during complete rendering failure
the developer page will also fail to render.

* feat: add support for argv.json switch to recover from failure

* chore: address feedback

* chore: update build

* chore: bump distro

title: fix: memory leak in createStyleSheet2
body:
Helps with #287753. Fixes memory leak in createStyleSheet2 by passing in a disposable store to `WrappedStyleElement` and `createStyleSheet`. 




### Before

When opening and closing peek definition 37 times, the number of detached style elements seems to grow by 1 each time: 

```json
{
  "className": "HTMLStyleElement",
  "description": "style",
  "stackTrace": [
    "createStyleSheet (vscode-file://vscode-app/vscode/out/vs/base/browser/domStylesheets.js:37:26)",
    "WrappedStyleElement.setStyle (vscode-file://vscode-app/vscode/out/vs/base/browser/domStylesheets.js:24:26)",
    "AutorunObserver._runFn (vscode-file://vscode-app/vscode/out/vs/base/browser/domStylesheets.js:134:7)",
    "AutorunObserver._run (vscode-file://vscode-app/vscode/out/vs/base/common/observableInternal/reactions/autorunImpl.js:84:16)",
    "new AutorunObserver (vscode-file://vscode-app/vscode/out/vs/base/common/observableInternal/reactions/autorunImpl.js:37:10)",
    "autorun (vscode-file://vscode-app/vscode/out/vs/base/common/observableInternal/reactions/autorun.js:6:10)",
    "createStyleSheetFromObservable (vscode-file://vscode-app/vscode/out/vs/base/browser/domStylesheets.js:133:13)",
    "new InlineCompletionsController (vscode-file://vscode-app/vscode/out/vs/editor/contrib/inlineCompletions/browser/controller/inlineCompletionsController.js:126:56)"
  ],
  "originalStack": [
    "/vscode/src/vs/base/browser/domStylesheets.ts:51:24",
    "/vscode/src/vs/base/browser/domStylesheets.ts:36:22",
    "/vscode/src/vs/base/browser/domStylesheets.ts:179:4",
    "/vscode/src/vs/base/common/observableInternal/reactions/autorunImpl.ts:110:10",
    "/vscode/src/vs/base/common/observableInternal/reactions/autorunImpl.ts:58:7",
    "/vscode/src/vs/base/common/observableInternal/reactions/autorun.ts:18:8",
    "/vscode/src/vs/base/browser/domStylesheets.ts:178:11",
    "/vscode/src/vs/editor/contrib/inlineCompletions/browser/controller/inlineCompletionsController.ts:161:53"
  ],
  "sourcesHash": "012b90aaf26bb759f59cacccb88c2c9e810f0d55",
  "count": 37
}
```

### After

When opening and closing peek definition 37 times, the number of stylesheet element stays constant.

* fix: memory leak in createStyleSheet2

* polish

title: Fix extension-specific default log levels not being applied
body:
Extension loggers were ignoring configured default log levels (e.g., "Trace" for GitHub Copilot Chat) and falling back to "Info". The issue occurred during logger initialization in the extension host. ## Root Cause In `extHostOutput.ts`, when creating a log output channel: ```typescript logLevel = this.loggerService.getLogLevel(logFile) ?? logLevel; ``` `getLogLevel(resource)` always returns a valueâ€”falling back to the global default when no logger exists. This overwrote the extension-specific default from `extensionLogLevel` config. ## Changes - Check for explicitly user-configured log levels using `getRegisteredLogger()` instead of `getLogLevel()` - `ILoggerResource.logLevel` is `undefined` when using defaults, allowing distinction between: - No logger exists yet â†’ preserve extension default - Logger exists with default â†’ preserve extension default - Logger exists with explicit level â†’ use explicit level ```typescript const registeredLogger = this.loggerService.getRegisteredLogger(logFile); if (registeredLogger?.logLevel !== undefined) { logLevel = registeredLogger.logLevel; } ```
Original prompt > > ---- > > *This section details on the original issue you should resolve* > > Does not apply default log level to extension correctly > I have Trace set as the default log level, as shown here, but by default it actually is always using Info. I really want to keep it at the trace level so I can check what's going on when something weird happens, but now I keep missing it. > > > > ## Comments on the Issue (you are @copilot in this section) > > > >
- Fixes microsoft/vscode#286664 --- âœ¨ Let Copilot coding agent [set things up for you](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/new?title=âœ¨+Set+up+Copilot+instructions&body=Configure%20instructions%20for%20this%20repository%20as%20documented%20in%20%5BBest%20practices%20for%20Copilot%20coding%20agent%20in%20your%20repository%5D%28https://gh.io/copilot-coding-agent-tips%29%2E%0A%0A%3COnboard%20this%20repo%3E&assignees=copilot) â€” coding agent works faster and does higher quality work when set up for your repo.

auto_merge.commit_title: Fix extension-specific default log levels not being applied (#287729)
auto_merge.commit_message:
* Initial plan

* Fix default log level not applied to extensions correctly

The issue was in extHostOutput.ts where getLogLevel() always returns a value (never undefined) because it falls back to the global default. This was overriding the extension-specific default log level.

Changed to only override if there's an explicitly set log level for that logger resource using getRegisteredLogger() which returns the ILoggerResource with logLevel as undefined when using default.

Co-authored-by: ulugbekna <16353531+ulugbekna@users.noreply.github.com>

* Improve comment clarity based on code review feedback

title: Stop diff computation when editor window is closed
body:
When a user closes a diff editor while computing diffs on a large file, VSCode continues the computation in the worker thread, wasting CPU resources.

## Changes

The diff algorithms now check if source models are disposed during computation:

**Added disposal checking to worker models**
- `MirrorModel` tracks disposal state via `isDisposed()` method
- Models are marked disposed when removed from worker via `$acceptRemovedModel`

**Created `ModelDisposalTimeout`**
- Wraps time-based timeout with model disposal checking
- Returns invalid when any model is disposed, stopping algorithm mid-computation

**Updated diff computation pipeline**
- Pass model references through `ILinesDiffComputerOptions.models`
- `EditorWorker.$computeDiff` checks disposal before starting and passes models to algorithms
- `DefaultLinesDiffComputer` uses `ModelDisposalTimeout` when models provided

**Backward compatible**
- Works without model references (falls back to time-only timeout)
- No breaking changes to existing API

## Implementation

Diff algorithms periodically call `timeout.isValid()` during computation. With `ModelDisposalTimeout`, this now checks both elapsed time and model disposal:

```typescript
export class ModelDisposalTimeout implements ITimeout {
	private readonly dateTimeout: DateTimeout | InfiniteTimeout;

	constructor(timeout: number, private readonly models: { isDisposed(): boolean }[]) {
		this.dateTimeout = timeout === 0 ? InfiniteTimeout.instance : new DateTimeout(timeout);
	}

	public isValid(): boolean {
		for (const model of this.models) {
			if (model.isDisposed()) {
				return false;  // Stop computation
			}
		}
		return this.dateTimeout.isValid();
	}
}
```

When models are disposed, the algorithm exits early with `hitTimeout: true`, freeing the worker thread.

title: Sanity tests pipeline and bug fixes
body:
Contributes towards #279402 

Make test/sanity NPM-install independent for faster initialization in the pipeline.

Fixed pipeline and tests ro fully pass on Windows x64 and MacOS x64.

Updated suite/test names to report nicely in ADO.

Ensure temp dir name is expanded on Windows to avoid ~ expansion from CLI.

Removed custom log file now that XML report is supported.

Added option to turn headless browsing on/off.

Added Windows arm64 and MacOS x64 jobs that run without runtime (validating downloads/signatures only).

labels.name: engineering
labels.description: VS Code - Build / issue tracking / etc.

title: Truncate long page titles in integrated browser
body:
Page titles exceeding 2000 characters cause tabs to extend beyond the visible area, making the integrated browser unusable.

## Changes

- Import `truncate()` utility from `base/common/strings` (same pattern as chat editor)
- Add `MAX_TITLE_LENGTH = 30` constant  
- Apply truncation in `BrowserEditorInput.getName()` for both model and initial data paths

## Implementation

Titles over 30 characters display with Unicode ellipsis (â€¦). Full URL remains accessible via hover tooltip through existing `getDescription()` method.

**Before**: `you have to write a really really long search to get to 2000 characters. like seriously, you have no idea how long it has to be2000 characters is absolutely freaking enormous. You can fit sooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo much data into 2000 characters...`

**After**: `you have to write a really reaâ€¦`

> <issue_description>Steps to Reproduce:

> 1. Run command "Browser: Open Integrated Browser"
> 2. Open a website that has an extremely long title, such as [this title: chat: wip on model-specific tools
body:
This is a rethinking of the initial API proposed in `languageModelToolSupportsModel.d.ts`.

1. This switches to `models?: LanguageModelChatSelector[];` to control enablement. definitely open to switching this out, but I think a synchronously-analyzable
   expression is important to retain the data flows in core without races.
2. The extension is able to define a tool at runtime via registerToolDefinition. This should let us have entirely service-driven tools from model providers without requiring a static definition for each one. We can also have model-specific variants of tools without a ton of package.json work for each variant of the tool (as initially proposed using `when` clauses)

This then propagates that down into the tools service. Currently I have this as just compiling to a `when` expression once it reaches the main thread. Then, for the tools service, it takes an IContextKeyService in cases where tools should be enumerated, and the chat input sets the model keys in its scoped context key service. This allows the tools to be filtered correctly in the tool picker.

I initially thought about allowing multiple definitions be registered for the same tool name/id for model-specific variants of tools but I realized that gets really gnarly and we already have a `toolReferenceName` that multiple tools can register into.

Todo for tomorrow morning:
- Tools don't make it to the ChatRequest yet, or something, still need to investigate
- Need to make sure tools in prompts/models all work. For a first pass I think we can
  let prompts/modes reference all tools by toolReferenceName.
- Validate that multiple tools actually can safely share a reference name (and do
  some priority ordering?)
- General further validation
- Some unit tests

title: Remove timeout warning, keep running
body:
Fixes #285434

This makes is so we no longer show the timeout warning and just continue to poll up to 2 minutes. After that we don't try to nudge the user or anything as it's perfectly valid for commands to run for longer than 2 minutes. We'll also have an explicit action to move to background soon.

Adding some verbose logging to test and it appears to be working correctly:

title: Support additional actions in integrated browser
body:
#286579

Also adds a setting to redirect from simple browser.

title: fix races in prompt for input
body:
fixes #287642

When a user manually entered input into the terminal before the input prompt was created, the prompt would still appear and hang around even after the command finished.

This happened bc the input listener was being set up too late - only after the LLM finished analyzing the terminal output. Any user input that happened between idle detection and prompt creation was missed.

Fixes:

1) The input listener is now set up immediately when idle is detected inside waitForIdle, not after returning from it. This eliminates the race window between detecting idle and handling the idle state.

2) Added checks for `_userInputtedSinceIdleDetected`at multiple points:

- Before calling the LLM to determine user input options
- After the LLM call returns
- After `_selectAndHandleOption()` (another LLM call)
- Right before showing any prompt UI

If the user has inputted at any of these checkpoints, we skip showing the prompt and continue polling instead.

3) Updated the LLM prompt to explicitly require that detected input prompts must appear at the VERY END of the terminal output with no content following them. Added examples showing prompts that were already answered should return null:

```
"Continue (y/n)? y" â†’ null (already answered with 'y')
"Do you want to proceed? (yes/no)\nyes\nProceeding..." â†’ null (answered with subsequent output)
```

auto_merge.commit_title: fix races in prompt for input  (#287651)

title: Fix chatSessionHasOptions context key set before evaluating option group visibility
make chat thinking stream screen reader accessible
body:
fixes #286777 

Adds a `ChatThinkingAccessibleView`, which can be accessed via a command. If no thinking is present, we alert to indicate that. Otherwise, we open the accessible view with the current thinking content. 

Uses `shift+alt+f2` to align with and extend the existing `alt+f2` one. 

- to discuss with screen reader users: should we clear the thinking content once thinking has stopped or leave it around until the next thinking stream comes in?

title: Integrated Browser - New Tab welcome screen
body: Add a "null state" or New Tab welcome screen that shows up when the Integrated Browser opens and before the user types a URL. Also ensures that this new welcome screen isn't applied a blur CSS filter when opening the command palette, by separating the blurrable placeholder screenshot into its own separate element. Related issue: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/286579

title: Close PR - Announce cursor position feature already implemented
body:
## Description

This PR was created to include the "Announce Cursor Position" command in the editor's accessibility help dialog. However, upon investigation, the feature is already fully implemented in the base code (commit 84efd92).

### Current State

The feature already exists at three integration points:

- **String definition** (`src/vs/editor/common/standaloneStrings.ts:37`): Defines localized text with keybinding placeholder
- **Help content** (`src/vs/workbench/contrib/accessibility/browser/editorAccessibilityHelp.ts:93`): Already includes announcement in accessibility help dialog
- **Action registration** (`src/vs/workbench/contrib/codeEditor/browser/accessibility/accessibility.ts:56-92`): Command `editor.action.announceCursorPosition` already registered with keybinding Cmd/Ctrl+Alt+Shift+G

The keybinding resolver (`accessibleViewKeybindingResolver.ts`) automatically processes `<keybinding:editor.action.announceCursorPosition>` placeholders to display actual key combinations or "(unassigned keybinding)" status.

### Conclusion

No code changes are included in this PR as the requested feature was already implemented before the branch was created. The issue appears to have been resolved prior to this work being assigned.

<!-- START COPILOT ORIGINAL PROMPT -->
